Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me on a one-month trip through Europe last summer. I used it in all kinds of situations and it performed excellent. I have received many complements on the night-time photography done with a tripod.

Reviews.Title: All the Right Camera Traits
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon S110 has a lot of functionality in a small box. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the lay of the land.The S110 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 12.1 resolution (megapixels), and x5 zoom. Probably the most important point for this class of cameras is the sensor size, which is 1/1.7 inch CMOS-type. That is just a number, but one that matters. Most point and shoots have a 1/2.3 inch sensor, which is a couple of steps worse than the S110.It does not have a viewfinder, which many in its class don't. The ISO rating is 12,800 which makes it work better in low light. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. The camera gives you the option to control manually both the exposure and the focus. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 461,000 resolution touchscreen, and the burst rate- for fast action- is 2.1. This is not a camera for sports photography, but it will perform well in continuous mode. The camera also does RAW processing which would be useful if you did not want to be limited by JPEG storage only. And all this with a light camera weighing only 198 grams.Overall, great camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Marked Down to a Bargain Price
Reviews.Author: D. Higbee
Reviews.Content: Since Canon's Powershot S110 is "last year's" model, it's marked down to about half price.  This is a bargain, on one of the best prosumer-type cameras that fits comfortably in your pocket.  I had had a short relationship with the excellent Panasonic LX7, and came back to Canon when I saw the markdown.  Photo quality is excellent, exposures are correct even in tricky lighting, and the camera is way speeder than my old Powershot S95.  I find the dials and menus easy to navigate, and I haven't had to crack the manual.  It takes great photos whether you want to go all automatic, or whether you like manual controls.  At this price, you can't go wrong.By the way, I recommend the Flipbac FBG2 Camera Grip - it fits well, adds little bulk, and makes it much easier to snap photos with one hand.  Flipbac FBG2 Camera Grip for Point & Shoot Digital CamerasThe BUILT E-CE20-SBM Neoprene Compact Camera Envelope, Summer Bloom is a wonderful little case that has just enough room for your camera and an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DFB "consumer"
Reviews.Content: bought this because my phone camera no longer focuses. More than that, I find the phone camera cumbersome and slow to use.This is small and can be difficult to hold while shooting, but I keep it in my pocket, I wanted small. This camera offers 100% control of settings, and optical stabilization. PSAM and even custom settings can be saved. A dial around the lens that can be assigned manual focus, zoom, ISO and more.Great pictures, 12mg sensor (plenty for a 1/1.7 chip) .Just what I wanted. No need to replace my phone!TIP: turn it on/off with the 'play' button, not power. Get a LowePro D-Wrap.

Reviews.Title: wide angle shots
Reviews.Author: kaye
Reviews.Content: I bought this about a year ago. It's not rugged but it's perfect for travelling as its wide angle shots really capture the scenery. It fell once, and the lens mechanism got broken immediately. But fortunately it was  still covered by Canon warranty so they fixed it for free.

Reviews.Title: Small but mighty
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Partin Johnson
Reviews.Content: I own a 'professional' Canon 60d that is absolutely wonderful, but I wanted something I could slip into my pocket and just take off with. This little thing does the trick.  I'm sure there are other cameras that are 'cheaper' that will do a good job,  but this one functions like a DSLR without the drama.  It does an amazing job in bright light and absolutely incredible in low light. The colors are vibrant and subjects are distinct...even before editing.  Usually with a 'point and shoot' camera, I don't do much editing...I use them more for candid type pictures.  This little thing even does a great job in arena's where the lighting is usually awful for taking any pictures.  Concerts came out great...basketball games came out great, with uniforms showing true to color.I've owned this camera for 9 months now...so I've given it a true test.The biggest down fall to this camera is where the flash button pops up.  It's right where I hold the camera with my left hand.  I've gotten used to it but if I hand the camera to someone else to take a picture that I'm going to be in, there finger 'holds down' the pop up flash.

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera for bicycling and traveling
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Slivka "Ben Slivka"
Reviews.Content: I bought my first digital camera (an Olympus D600-L, 1.2mp, 3x optical zoom, ~$800) in 1997.  The compact flash cards (giant by the standards of SD, let alone microSD cards) only held 12 or 24 exposures (shades of film), but the ability to upload them quickly to the web was such an improvement over film cameras.  I upgraded to smaller, higher-resolution cameras over the years, and bought my first digital SLR in 2002 (a Canon D60): which produced fantastic images with almost no shutter lag.  But all of these cameras were a bit bulky (especially the SLR).The I bought a PowerShot S95 in August, 2010.  What a delight!  Small enough to fit into my shorts pocket or in the back pocket of my bicycle jersey, decent (10mp) resolution and zoom, and tolerable shutter lag.The S110 is a nice upgrade to the S100 (which I also owned) and the S95 -- a bit more resolution, a few more features (HDR) -- while still retaining the compact size, easy-to-use controls, and great image quality.I did some side-by-side shooting comparisons between my most recent SLR (a Canon 40D) and the S110 -- and the S110 photos are better (the only advantage the SLR has is zero shutter lag and snapping of a series of shots).I may never use an SLR again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sooganthy Nadarajah
Reviews.Content: I bought this after trying several point and shoots. Nothing comes close to this one. The Image stabilization along with the quality of the photos are quite close to  my husbands DSLR ones. Am extremely happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Performs as Expected
Reviews.Author: Robin L. Bring
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures; compact; easy to use . . . totally pleased.  I can tuck it in a pocket or my purse and be assured of having a good picture of the unexpected sight or event.  I do not carry a cell phone, certainly not a smart phone, so this is a good fit for my lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and HD video
Reviews.Author: Maria Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D-60 with a Nikkor zoom so I'm used to great pictures.  Because of plans to take my Grandson to Disney, I decided I didn't want to lug around the Nikon, it's heavy.  I've always loved Canon camera's and printers so decided to give this one a try.  I love it.  It is amazingly lightweight and small but the pictures are honestly almost as good as the Nikon.  The zoom naturally isn't as good for far away shots but for up close shots zoomed in, it's superior.  The HD video is superb better than my Canon CMOS pro.  I sure I will get some amazing shots of my Grandson at Disney.  I recommend buying a few extra batteries as these run out pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap died in 2 months
Reviews.Author: A. G. Tzelepis
Reviews.Content: "Lens Error"Just like the "legendary" S100, S95, etc.Do not buy this garbage.Now Amazon says I can't return it because it's past 30 days? A $400 goddamned camera dies in 2 months and I have to jump through hoops to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot S110
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera takes excellent shots low light shots and the videos it takes are high quality as well.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't any happier
Reviews.Author: mhemling33
Reviews.Content: So far the camera has done everything I could want of it. I am no photographer I just wanted something a little nicer then your average point and shoot and this worked out perfectly. I have even started to mess with manual setting and I am really impressed about everything it can do. It's ability to act as a wifi hotspot so you can link your phone/tablet to it and send pictures is actually really nice since they can't take the memory card like a computer. The video quality is excellent and the picture quality is better then I imagined. If you are an average person looking for something a little nicer grab this you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Powerful, compact, incredible camera. We LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: Randall A. Juip
Reviews.Content: I have owned three cameras in this family - the S90, which was replaced by a newer, shinier S100, which was the victim of some clumsy stair negotiation, and now, this model, the S110. They were all fantastic cameras, but after about 1000 pictures, I have to declare the S110 the best yet.It's sturdy. Compact. And its amazing. It helps that I'm photographing my gorgeous wife and amazingly beautiful children, but even when I'm shooting landscapes, crowd shots or self-portraits(!), the shots turn out amazingly well. This camera is so good, and the images are so rich and colorful that, after I batch import my shots from the S110 and my Canon 40D into my computer, I have a difficult time telling which camera shot which pictures.Canon is consistently producing well-built, sturdy, competent cameras. The S110 is no exception to this. You'll never be able to fit a full DSLR into your back pocket, but fret not! With the S110, you'll be in good shape anyway.

Reviews.Title: Very good point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Happy camper
Reviews.Content: Given how good the phone cameras are today and how much easier it is to use a phone as a camera since you always have it with you, a point and shoot has to do some things significantly better than a phone to be worth bothering.Having an iPhone 5, the canon s110 does a few things better.  It does better in low light and allows for zooming. While zooming isn't critical since you can reframe things digitally afterwards, the s110 is still going to focus faster and take cleaner shots. Someday soon though, I don't think there will be much point in owning a point and shoot. It will be your phone or a dslr.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera with cool features and some flaws, but ultimately outgunned.
Reviews.Author: Jetmaker
Reviews.Content: I'd been shopping the Canon S110 versus the Sony DSC-RX100. I bought the S110 hoping it would be a good enough camera at its price point and save me the $300 price difference. I had it for a week and was generally pleased despite a few flaws, but the thought of the RX100 photo quality kept nagging at me. So I relented and ordered the RX100 and have made a thorough comparison conducting extensive side by side photo shoots. Though the S110 has some really nice features that make it tempting to keep, and also save the extra money, the RX100 photo quality exceeds it by such a large degree that I ended up sending the S110 back. The following is the summary of my comparison.The S110 is lightweight and easy to grasp. The button labels printed on the camera are larger and easier to read and the buttons themselves are larger than those on the RX100. It's menu system is intuitive and easy to use and is aided even more by the touch screen. The touch screen also enhances the photo-taking functions by activating a secondary function for the control ring when you place your thumb on the right hand edge of the screen. The wi-fi is a convenient time saver. However the app won't work on my Android tablet which was a big disappointment. Picture quality on the S110 is inconsistent. Auto mode produces photos that are overexposed, overly vivid, and the color tempurature far too much on the cool side. They are essentially unusable for me. You can get decent pictures in Program AE mode but you will need to play with settings to find what works best for you in given conditions. Even then you may be in for some post-processing work to get them "dialed in". Overall I feel my six year old Canon SD800IS produces equal or better results. HDR mode requires a tripod (or very steady hand) and does not always produce a good end results in-camera. Further post-processing is still needed. Battery life on the S110 is poor. It is made worse by the fact that the battery indicator gives little warning of battery death. It did leave me stranded with a dead battery once. You'll need spares with you at all times. The Canon software is very good and makes uploading easy and also provides excellent info on all the settings used in the photos.RX100 picture quality is phenomenally better than S110 in almost all cases. The only exception is in macro mode where the S110 is close (but the RX100 still better). The DRO and HDR functions on the RX100 are worth the price of admission by themselves by ensuring very good in-camera results. The low light capabilities of the Sony are incredible and in another league entirely than the Canon. The RX100 menu system is sometimes awkward, forcing you to push buttons or turn dials unnecessarily to scroll through options. It is also not as intuitive as the S110 so you sometimes have to use some trial and error to find the function you want. The screen is very bright after setting it to sunshine mode, and it has very nice resolution. It is noticeably better than the S110 screen. Due to its weight and large diameter lens the handing quality of the RX100 is not as sure footed as the Canon. Sony made an ergonomic blunder in putting the movie button beside the thumb rest which makes the thumb pad much smaller than it could have been, which I think would have greatly aided the handling quality. I prefer the smooth operation of the Sony function ring as opposed to the clunky detents of the Canon. The Sony software is good and has a couple of unique features but overall I preferred the Canon software.To conclude, the S110 is a very good integrated design package that has some cool features. Its battery life is a frustrating inconvenience. But its generally unremarkable photo quality and poor Auto mode seal its fate for me. The RX100 has stellar photo quality but is less refined in menu and handling than the Canon. The RX100 has a much better screen and battery life. Both have good software. The shortfalls of the RX100 versus S110 are minor. The S110 has the cool features of wi-fi and touch screen that are nice conveniences that one can ultimately live without. As an overall package for my needs and budget the RX100 wins even at the much higher price point.

Reviews.Title: Lens & Flash failures
Reviews.Author: Mamagiggles
Reviews.Content: Great camera when it works. Had 2 lens failures where the lens motor dies. Had to send to service center in Va. Beach twice in 6 months. Flash just burned out last week and not covered. Avoid canon point & shoots. When you send them back and the repairs not covered, if you don't want to pay return shipping and labor to diagnose, they keep the camera, fix it then sell it as a refurb.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Darcy M. Wilson
Reviews.Content: This camera is small and easy to use.  My daughter took it on a trip to Europe and returned with many wonderful photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon Quality
Reviews.Author: M Douglas Otten
Reviews.Content: So simple and easy to use, compact and easy to carry. I use it for location scouting and my personal camera, then I don't need to take my professional camera into the field unless it is getting paid to be there.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: SYED ARIF RAHMAN
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality and HD video. Takes great picture in low light places with out flash. Perfect to carry in your pant's pocket.  When using flash, picture does not look good....

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Cybershopper
Reviews.Content: Got this at 219, a great price. This camera takes great pictures day or night, the auto mode works really well and has all the manual controls if you need it. Overall speed of the camera is more than fast enough. Wi fi is actually pretty easy...to your smartphone that is, haven't tried to connect wirelessly to my computer. The free canon gateway app is easy to use and downloading pics from the s110 to your phone is painless. Never tried using the video yet. Battery life seems weak as just taking 80 or so photos without any video already has depleted the battery half way. Wish the lcd screen resolution was better, but the touchscreen is very responsive and great to use. Overall though for 219 with a free memory card and case its an awesome deal.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: uL
Reviews.Content: Very small, fits in pants pocket. great pictures, even in low light. nice advanced settings (e.g., Aperture) not available in basic compact models.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ali Moosvi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the objective of getting a decent Hi-Def video and  still pictures.  I have this camera for several months now and have used it both indoor and outdoors, day time and night time.  The night video I took recently at a wedding party with no special lighting far exceeded my expectations.  The daytime vidoe is fabulous. In fact, when I played it on my 1080p 70" Sony TV, the video and quality was better than any of the Hi-Def channels I get on my dish newtworks.  This camera provides a true 1080p hi-def video quality Vs the hi-def TV channels that actually broadcadst a max of 720p resolution on dishnetwork.The still camera pictures are pretty decent both indoors and outdoors. It could be better if I spend some time reading the basics on what settings to use in various situations.I have seen videos and pictures from the bulky expensive SLR cameras taken by semi-professionals and when I compare them to the Canon S110 pictures/videos taken by me (an amateur),  I feel proud. My pictures and videos are equally good if not better at 1/3rd of the cost plus the convenience of carrying the camera in my pocket. It is hard to believe that Canon can pack so much video and still picture quality in a compact camera.This camera also has some other features that are nice such as WiFi, direct HDMI connectivity, etc.The only con is the flash location.  It is in located on the camera where you would normally keep one of your left hand fingers.  The first few times I was startled but once you get used to it you know not to keep your finger there.I will recommend this camera to anyone hands down.

Reviews.Title: Nice size, good photos
Reviews.Author: Roy E. Lachman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small point-and-shoot that took better quality photos than my lower-end point and shoot, and was quickly ready for new photos.  This has a large sensor, and does the trick.  Very good size--not too big to put in your pocket, but not so small it is awkward to use.  Only drawback--if it is that--is that it has a lot of features to choose from if you stray from automatic settings.  You don't have to learn them, but they are there if you want higher levels of control, etc. Remarkable how much is in a small package.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: HappyBirthdayToMe
Reviews.Content: I like this camera so much.I'm a self-described camera fail in choosing camera duds over the years. I ordered this one a little too close to a much anticipated overseas vacation and consequently didn't leave myself too much time to learn all the features before leaving.This little pocket camera didn't disappoint, even just on the Auto settings at short notice. It captured all I wanted to and more. I was thrilled to not have been disappointed with memories of my vacation of a lifetime. The feedback on my holiday photos has been great from others. I even ended up with stellar photos taken from a window of a fast moving vehicle taken at a moment's notice.I had the chance to play around with a few features on vacation and look so forward to getting to know more.I love the looks of it with it's simple and basic design and not a lot of bling and complicated buttons and dials. For a plain looking little camera, it has so much capability.I suggest giving yourself some time to learn what it can do before an important event, buy an extra battery or two and a good case (which I did), and play to your hearts content.I can't wait to get to know this camera inside and out with all of the great features it has. Finally, for me, a winner.

Reviews.Title: This is now at a great price in December, 2013
Reviews.Author: M. Hale
Reviews.Content: Solid camera.  Now at a wonderful price.  I'm using is as a carry-around and also for digiscoping with a birding scope.  Works very well and very much well priced at 219.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Debbie C.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!!  It is so easy to use and takes fantastic pictures and videos.  I love the amount of zoom you get for such a small camera.  My son graduated from basic training and then airborne school (was my reason for a new camera).  I was able to take the camera with me both times.  I now have awesome pictures and was not weighted down by carrying a heavy camera around.  It's very user friendly and if you ever owned a similar camera you can almost figure out how to use it on your own.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for Photo, but very bad battery life, over heat on video
Reviews.Author: Savann
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my family vacation, I have been a Canon user for all my life. This camera is one of the best point and shoot camera in term of photo quality, but very weak battery life. If you want buy this camera for video, you need to think twice, because of over heat issue.

Reviews.Title: No more need for my Canon SLR
Reviews.Author: S. Bagley
Reviews.Content: A few weeks before taking a trip overseas my other Canon PowerShot was dropped and you could hear a sound in the camera although it continued to take great pictures.  Not wanting to take the risk with a faulty lens I purchased this camera knowing I would be taking pictures in low light situations where the built-in flash wouldn't help the exposure.  This camera was able to handle everything with little to no manipulation from the auto setting (turn off the flash and let the fast lens do it's job).  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, with new wifi functionality!
Reviews.Author: Camilo Delfino
Reviews.Content: Great pocket camera, small size, big sensor and fast lens that make you able to do great night shots, and even play with some light painting with long exposure times!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Redhead18
Reviews.Content: High quality pictures for the price. The images are wonderful quality and the camera is easy to useand light weight. The battery charger is simple and easy to use. Not many wires to contend with.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Alia
Reviews.Content: I haven't used a point and shoot since my 4MP Canon elph years ago. I was looking first for a compact camera that could shoot in RAW, which this does. It also has a full manual mode, which is fantastic if you're a DSLR user that isn't really accustomed to point and shoots, or just want a nice manual camera that isn't as large as your DSLR. The control rings are customizeable by function, and even the touch focus can be turned on and off . The screen is large and bright, and the photos are crystal clear (even when taking underwater photos  with the canon underwater casing). It has only been a couple weeks, so I have not used the wifi functions yet, but I could not be happier with this camera and the quality of photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan Shimada
Reviews.Content: Like the camera, good size took some great photos, and was allot better than I expected I would recommend it it anyone looking for a small camera with more control.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Charly
Reviews.Content: Its a great camera, I bought this to update my S95, I still havent notice big changes in quality of the photos but it definitely has a better look and new specs like Wifi and touchscreen, so far it has perform perfect.

Reviews.Title: Would be perfect if wifi function and gps worked better
Reviews.Author: staticantics
Reviews.Content: This is such a great camera. It performs awesome, gives me all of the manual and raw functions i want and need that fits in my pocket.Two gripes only.Unfortunately the built in WiFi functionality only works with Canon apps or direct to social networks via Canon's image sharing service.Likewise with the GPS. If you dont carry around your smartphone and do GPS logging with the Canon app on your smartphone, the GPS function is almost useless.I hold out hope that future improvements will make the WiFi better, but for picture quality and battery life, I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery excellent price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "NutsoNutz"
Reviews.Content: I have owned and owe canon cameras. The s100 series hits it out of a "ballpark". Picture quality is great and manual function control reaches that of an SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: When You Can't Carry a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gamble "Music Maven"
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade to the S100 which has been discontinued. The major concerns have been addressed with only slight annoyances remaining. I had the S100 and while it served me well after a coworker purchased the S110, I sold my S100 and purchased the S110. If you are a serious amateur to pro, the one rule is, you never go anywhere without a camera so if I'm out, this is on my belt and have caught some amazing images. At 12.1 MP I can post process up to 16 x 22 without loss of quality. I must emphasize I am using resizing software to accomplish that but is minimal resize and could go farther. My opinion is this is the best pocket camera on the market as I always do my research before purchasing. My suggestions would be to add a second battery, a belt carry case (if your a guy) or a case to protect if your a women. The screen protector: LARMOR by GGS Self-Adhesive Optical Glass LCD Screen Protector for CANON is great and there is a small pocket tripod that I cannot locate right now but very handy.Enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, easy wifi uploading
Reviews.Author: Marcus Censor
Reviews.Content: Having owned the s90 and the s95, I knew to expect good things from this camera. It's the perfect compromise between portability and features. I have been especially impressed with the Macro focus shots I've been able to get. Low-light performance is also very good.I carry my white s110 in the COSMOS ® Dark Brown PU Leather Case Cover Bag For Canon Powershot S110 Digital Camera with Cosmos Fastening Strap and it looks very sharp.A word about wifi transfers: the speed at which photos and movies are uploaded to your computer depends on your home internet speed, not on the s110. Reviewers who experience slow uploads shouldn't blame the s110. I use the wifi option to upload photos to my laptop after a day of shooting and it's a very easy process.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera, worth the money, has lots of capabilities, good low light performance
Reviews.Author: J. Osgood
Reviews.Content: I like this camera quite a bit.  I'm happy with my purchase and think it is worth the rather steep price tag.  I have been a long-time Canon point and shoot user.  My previous camera was the SD880IS.  The S110 is a significant step-up.  The camera is very fast.  Photo quality is excellent and the low light performance is strong.  I can see myself using this camera for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: WIFI IS AWFUL!!!
Reviews.Author: robert balotin "Robert J Balotin, MD"
Reviews.Content: Great cameraGood pics, relatively easy to useWIFI system is awful, very difficult to set up, customer service has been limited, I find it near impossible to contact them during their limited hours, the two times I tried the call failed.  Their email support is extremely limited.  Needless to say I still don't have any WIFI set up after three weeks.  Don't buy this camera if you care about this feature.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot S110 - Covers more ground
Reviews.Author: Parker Hallam
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot S110 is a sleek and light weight camera that may be compact but comes loaded with advanced features. What I liked most about the digital camera is that it is WiFi compatible meaning I can post my photos on social networking sites without having to wait to download onto my computer. The 12.1 MP ensure high resolution images and even more I can click away without having to worry about low light as the camera delivers stunning images even in low light. The touch panel LCD makes it convenient to browse through images and for setting as well. I can get more than what I want as the 24mm wide angle lens can captures more pictures on my frame. Apart from this there are loads of shooting modes to choose from. Power Shot S110 is definitely a must have for travelers.

Reviews.Title: Zoom broke after a few months--Grrr Camera costs too much for this to happen
Reviews.Author: Jane F. Gilgun "I'm a professor at the Univer...
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with the camera for a few months. Then I noticed that when I used the zoom, I could hear the whirr. After that, it was hard to control the zoom.  Now the zoom doesn't work at all. This is inexcusable for an camera this expensive and that had such rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: Beware - software doesn't work on a Mac
Reviews.Author: Lonchodomas
Reviews.Content: 4/27/13The software mentioned in the below review has been updated and works.  For that reason, I am going to up the rating on this product.  It was previously 3 stars.  I now rate it 5 stars.  I do warn you, the software installation could be frustrating.  When I connect my camera wirelessly to my computer, iPhoto wants to open as a default.  I can close that, and then open ImageBrowser EX.  That will import the photos.Since the previous writing, I took an overseas trip, and found the 24 mm wide angle lens very good for photographing architecture and art inside cathedrals.  My primary interest in this camera was the wide angle lens and smaller size.I wish the wireless transfer to my Nexus 7 was faster, but it works.I have taken photos in the evening, and low light conditions seem to work well for me.========At the time of this writing (3/2/13), part of the software that comes with this camera (CameraWindow DC 8) does not work on an iMac (I'm running O/S 10.7.5).  The Cannon help desk told me this, after I had fooled with the setup for a couple hours, and finally called help.  They say an update is coming out.  If it does, I'll try to update this review.  What this means, is that some of the suave wireless features advertised by Cannon, don't work with the iMac.I should point out, the software does install.  But what will happen, when you try to connect, you'll get an error message that says Camera Not Found.  And this is true whether you're using the USB cable, or trying to connect wirelessly.I was able to setup the wireless to transfer files to my Nexus 7 tablet.  To do this, I had to download a Cannon app from the Google App store.  And then on the camera, the transfer is done when choosing the Android phone option.  This will only work if you are signed onto WiFi.I am also able to use the WiFi to transfer files to my desktop.  But its done through iPhoto.  The help desk said iPhoto couldn't do it, but it does work.So in essence, the Cannon S110 does what I want.  I'm able to transfer files onto my tablet when I'm in a WiFi zone.  And using WiFi, I'm able to transfer photos into iPhoto.But I'm not able to use CameraWindow DC 8, and then the Cannon iMage Gateway (web based).  And that's disappointing.I do not have a full review of the hardware yet.  But I wanted to get this note out, to let purchasers with iMac's be aware.I should add one more thing.  Because the camera comes with WiFi capability, I bought a regular SD card.  On my other camera, I have a Eye-Fi CD card.  That's basically a WiFi retrofit.  Setting up Eye-Fi can be finicky too.  But I think the file transfer speed on Eye-Fi might be faster than what I'm seeing with the Cannon.I'm hoping this camera turns out to be a good camera.  I have taken pictures with it, and they've come out well.  My primary interest in it is that it has some wide angle capability (24 mm).  I'm not an expert on cameras, but wanted something with more of a wide angle than my previous camera.If the software is fixed, and and the camera turns out well, I'll increase my present 3 star rating.  But for now, I can't give it more than 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: What a great little P&S;!
Reviews.Author: Shannon Guy
Reviews.Content: I am anti point and shoot camera, but I had seen some amazing work done with one of these, and decided to check it out myself. I was still unsure about it when I finally purchased it- and was quickly impressed. I love all the options, being able to manually change settings, the video quality is amazing... and the slow motion video has brought tons of laughter into our home! I purchased the underwater housing for this, and have done some testing with it, and been VERY impressed! This little guy has changed my views on P&S; cameras!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding pocket camera
Reviews.Author: John "MacTruck"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 8 months and 2000 pictures.  It still works flawlessly and I love the Canon Android app that lets me transfer pictures to my phone with the S110's wi-fi.  I can't say that the picture quality matches my wife's Canon DSLR, but I have taken many more 'keepers' with this camera since it's so much easier to bring along while traveling.  I added a protective film to the LCD screen and the touch controls still work great.

Reviews.Title: I upgraded from another Canon Pro S series
Reviews.Author: Cabbit
Reviews.Content: I won't go in to too much technical detail. I am not a professional photographer, but I know several, and they all recommended this. My most frustrating experience is that most point-and-shoot cameras do not handle low-light situations. I am a night owl and typically take photos at night, in a bar, at a restaurant; so it was crucial to not get grainy, or over-exposed photos when using flash. Every "low light" setting on any point-and-shoots have been disappointing, as if turning on the flash and strobing it was going to help. Low aperture, mid-high ISO will get you a pretty beautiful dimly lit alley-way shot on a rainy night.Menu is intuitive. LCD touch screen is massive, so make sure to get a protective cover. Wireless setup is pretty flawless. The camera software is a bit slow, but preferable to others, I think. Transfer can be slow depending on your network configuration, obviously.Be SUPER careful about putting your finger on the flash bulb cause it pops up right where you want to stabilizing the camera while shooting.Portability wise it's a little bigger than the typical point-and-shoot, but I'm a functional kind of girl and much prefer beautiful photos than a candy-colored snapper in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Absolutly best bang for buck point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Dammika J "Dammika"
Reviews.Content: I have the Sony RX100 II now which is what I replaced this with, I gave my old S110 to my aunt and bought a new one for my parents.Both parties equally technologically challenged, both parties now sending great quality pictures.this camera is my absolute fav worth every penny very highly recommended.!It's not as good as the Sony Rx100, but it's more pocket able, lighter and is much better value for money. The 2nd best packet point and shoot yuo can buy I would say!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: SD Cardsmith
Reviews.Content: It's amazing what Canon could do with this little, convenient camera. Great design and user interface, even better photos, and the video quality is a bonus...if you can find one it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: great little raw shooting camera
Reviews.Author: Rmac "scuba47"
Reviews.Content: I like shooting in raw. This little pocket camera gives the user so much control over shooting, it's a fantastic camera.I like the control, but battery life is short, you need an extra battery which is no problem; batteries are cheap.I give the camera a 5 star because it is a 5 star camera.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: James Brenneman
Reviews.Content: Got it for my mom. She is struggling with the awkward controls but she likes it!Images are great and no real cons to mention.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: José Ignacio Atria
Reviews.Content: Whe my Canon HS 210 s stopped working, I decided to have this camera.  Great decision: when I was in Times Squeare, NY, I got great pictures in low light conditions. Nontheless, I think it's not as fast as they say, I mean focusing takes some more seconds long before focusing.

Reviews.Title: Love the Canon S110
Reviews.Author: Cutie
Reviews.Content: I love this compact Canon S110.  I have the white camera, which is cute and beautiful.  The images are clear and sharp.  I love the touch screen.  For the Wi-Fi, I can connect this camera to my smartphone to view the photos from my camera on my smartphone, I can send my photos directly from this camera to Canon Image Gateway, Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, and other person emails.  But I cannot send send my photos from this camera to my computer and printer wirelessly.  To setup the Wi-Fi, I watched the video from youtube.  Reading the manual on the CD is hard to understand on how to setup the Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the size
Reviews.Author: qualityonly "erosennin"
Reviews.Content: Best build quailty, ergonomic and super compact for such big sensor in compact size.  Good low light quality, and the touch screen is very nice, bright and responsive.  It also have very good wifi for streaming or remote control via phone.  Not as good as SLR but no SLR have this size and the f/2 lens is very bright with automatic lenscap.  It is smaller than your phone and have much higher image quality than any phone even compared to 24 Mpix nokia.  Because the size of the sensor and lens speed matter the most out of just stupid megapixel.

Reviews.Title: A DSLR quality feature set from a tiny box
Reviews.Author: C. J. Clavadetscher "quickshot carl"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera for its size, which is "diminutive"... It has all the features of cameras far larger EXCEPT for a hot shoe. It has a very fast lens, super quality, and has generated for me superb images including under very low light.  Easy to use. Results you will love. Very smart DIGIC chip. I shot a night XMAS event two weeks ago with this and the shots got rave reviews. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Really impressed with this camera.
Reviews.Author: asher
Reviews.Content: I just received and am getting acquainted but so far so good.  It takes amazing pictures in the night time.  I really like how it's a literally point and shoot camera.  I can't be bothered with changing settings for each picture I want to take.  I just want to take a picture and this camera has met those needs for me.  I would recommend this camera to others.  Oh and yes it does take getting used to the location of the flash but it's not a killer for me.

Reviews.Title: Much easier than the big guys.
Reviews.Author: Glagen "glagen"
Reviews.Content: Bought to take on the 2 week trip as our Cannon Eos proved to be much too heavy to lug around all day.  This little guy takes great pics and has plenty of flexibility.  Slip in your pocket and off you go!  Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: Had a the previous incarnation of this camera...lasted 6 years and tens of thousands of photos.  So far, just as happy with this
Reviews.Author: Thor Kennedy
Reviews.Content: The wireless option is awesome.  I'm able to transfer to my iPad wherever I'm at.I am a point and shoot....kind of guy, and the automatic mode is my friend. The camera is a fantastic machine for a really good value.  The one thing that I would change would be to add back the traditional viewfinder....but I'll get over 'old school' someday soon.This being my 2nd point and shoot, Canon compact, I'd definitely recommend it.  Great photos!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Just  a great camera, no errors here.
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Love it. Great portable pocket camera with all the functions I need and then some. No lens error here, or any other  error for that matter.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Lee S. Pendleton
Reviews.Content: iT'S FINE.  MUCH BETTER THAN WHAT I HAD BEFORE.  PARTICULARLY LIKE THE RAPID SHOOTING SEQUENCES.  QUITE EASY TO USE AND INTUITIVE.

Reviews.Title: Wow, wotta camera!
Reviews.Author: Raincoconuts
Reviews.Content: Compact, fits comfortably Case Logic(ed) in the front pocket of my jeans! Tested in Bhutan last week, it does well!Low light was a problem with my 5 year old Canon Elph, the S110 takes some spectacular pictures even in low light.The camera is easy to use, controls feel good, not too comfortable with the wi-fi seems overly complicated to set up,I'm not doing it anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Pmac
Reviews.Content: I don't know crap about cameras and so I'm still figuring out the inner workings of this thing, but so far I love it. Have been trying to venture from "auto" mode, but auto takes such good pictures that it doesn't motivate you to expand your skills. You can basically turn it on, press the shutter button, and take a great picture. Didn't see it in many other reviews that here is also a simple app available for android/apple that will let you view/download pics from the phone on your phone tablet. Cool. Also takes good video, was able to take pics/vids of my new daughter being born in what some might consider a bothersome level of detail. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Hervandil M. S. Anna
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is wonderful.Nice functions, lots of settings and there is a slow motion video very interesting.But I didn't like two things:1) It is very difficult to not lock the flash when it goes up. The place where it is located is very close to the place where we naturally place our fingers.2) The Wi-FI function is not very easy to use. It should be something more direct to connect to computers.Despite those two issues, it is a good choise!

Reviews.Title: Impressive camera . . .
Reviews.Author: The Rabbi
Reviews.Content: I continue to be impressed with the Canon S110 -- both picture quality and features.  This camera has many useful features packed into a small package, more flexibility than most people will need.  It is my take-everywhere camera and I rarely encounter a situation where it is not up to the job at hand.  In my opinion, it is the current king of the compact digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Raul Amador
Reviews.Content: Has a lot of manual adjustments but, takes great pictures in Auto as well. Low light pictures look great. My SLR will be used less now that we have a serious compact camera. It will not replace an SLR but, it's a great camera to have on you all the time. Transferring pictures to my phone is simple and allows me to share them instantly.

Reviews.Title: The best!!!
Reviews.Author: Ernesto Olascoaga
Reviews.Content: Excellent, it works better than expected. Very easy to use. Excellent pictures. Canon keeps the leadership. It is very light.

Reviews.Title: Finally got a smiling picture from my 3 yr old.
Reviews.Author: Deja
Reviews.Content: The two best features for me (a mom and a photo nut) are the smile recognition feature and the spot color feature.The smile recognition feature has enabled me to actually get a shot of my 3 yr old smiling instead of his normal "cheese" face where one eye is shut and his lip is snarled.The spot color is really cool. You choose which color you want the picture to show and the rest of the picture turns black and white. I have tried this quite a few times and it works wonderfully. Really cool for those special effects.These are my two favorite features, but I really love the entire camera. From the white outer casing to the huge touch screen LCD this camera is awesome and takes fantastic pictures in all kinds of light. So glad I bought it.P.S. The HD video recording is amazing. Even in low light the videos look awesome!

Reviews.Title: Realistic travel option
Reviews.Author: brandon adams
Reviews.Content: I substituted this for my entry level dslr, and was extremely impressed by the ease of use with the touch screen and camera ring.I would recommend for anyone who values mobility, and is willing to sacrifice a minor amount of quality to avoid carrying around a full bodied camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot 110
Reviews.Author: DAVID W. COOK
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  Only problem is that it is so smart, it takes forever to learn all the aspects of the thing.  If you just take automatic pictures it is ready to go and takes fantastic pictures.  if you download the manual and print it out, be prepared to print 346 pages.  This camera does so many things I cannot mention all of them.  But to give you and idea...you can set the camera for a delayed shutter so you can get in the picture....and you make shutter click by blinking you eye....amazing.Buy it, you'll like it.DWCNOLNew Orleans

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: B. A. Sardinas "Warlock"
Reviews.Content: JPEG + RAW in a small package.  Good value. Works like a pro camera in an ultra portable package. woot.

Reviews.Title: Still one of the best
Reviews.Author: HC "Quik MKIV"
Reviews.Content: I've owned every generation of PowerShot "S" models, and they keep getting better. Fast to focus, and great shot outputs. The manual controls are intuitive and quick to master. I carry this little guy as a backup, and when I just don't want to haul around all that (SLR) glass. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot s110
Reviews.Author: Ken S. Shimizu
Reviews.Content: although, you cant compare these point and shoots to an slr,  this is a very good camera.  i like the idea that you can just pocket it and the hd video is excellent.  the only gripe i have is the location of the pop-up flash.  it's in an area that i usually place my finger (maybe it's just me) and if the flash tries to pop up and my finger is there, sometimes it will get an error message and i have to power down and restart camera.

Reviews.Title: Makes me feel like a protographer lol
Reviews.Author: Applecrumble and Finch
Reviews.Content: Man this camera is off the chain....i can take photos in low light...high light...while the object is moving...while im moving...and i only 2wice since christmas have i had to delete 2 or 3 photos cause of the blurriness cause its that darn good...sometimes with the touchscreen i even forget that its not an iphone...pulled it out once or twice to make a call as well...bruajaj...very awesome product

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This little camera is phenomenal! Image quality is great for this sized rig, the front dial is outstanding, touchscreen is responsive and by no means a gimmick. It is just as responsive as the iPhone 5 touchscreen, and just as useful. Wifi has proven to be a bit tricky to get working, but this does not hold me back from the recommendation. It is so slender that I find I'd often opt to carry it over my Canon G9. No way that it will replace a DSLR, but it is the latest evolution in the compact point-and-shoots.

Reviews.Title: Great PS Camera
Reviews.Author: Josh Yang
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.  one of the best that I have ever used.  the price was a little to high, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: Its a good small size camera to have when you need it
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I have my Canon EOS Rebel T4i for taking photos on vacations, nature and special memorable occasions.  I was also looking to invest in a small digital camera just to have when you go out to parties, the beach and for every day.  This camera takes better images than my iPhone 5 so its perfect for what I need.  This camera is so small that it fits into my small crossbody bag and I can carry it with me every day because you just never know when you will need to snap a photo.The price is also worth it, when compared to other small digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good enough in this size and price level
Reviews.Author: M. E. Özsoy "twingo"
Reviews.Content: Pros:*Good size*Nice touchscreen response*Built quality and feel*Overall response speed*Best choice in piano white color, forget the black and grey versionsCons:*No preset for fast moving object shots*Fair battery life*Wi-fi is hard to adjust (hint.Use S120 softwares for camera window)*No Euro plug included*No printed manuals included, only in CD

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon S110
Reviews.Author: Eddie G
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon fanatic.  I have four generations of Canon cameras from the original Canon Elph 135 mmm to this one. I love the way the feel in my hands and their ease of operations, not to mention the quality of the photographs produced.  I would fully recommend this product to anyone who is in the market.

Reviews.Title: Canon S110 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD Screen (Silver)
Reviews.Author: JJS "jjsifo"
Reviews.Content: This camera delivers excellent image quality for the price,compact,very high quality built.Probably one of the best deals available today.And the seller is great also.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Sampaio
Reviews.Content: Excellent point and shoot. Great films. It's the best camera for every situation.  The size is perfect To fit the jeans front pocket.

Reviews.Title: Value for money!
Reviews.Author: Umesh Satyanarayana "Umesh"
Reviews.Content: Good value for money!  Appealing design, features are good.  Enjoyed using in both video and still photography mode.  Thanks Canon!

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Tree
Reviews.Content: This camera has the perfect size, quality pictures and price combination .  I would recommend this latest version from Canon over all previous models.

Reviews.Title: I am enjoying this camera. A good supplement for a dSLR. A good camera for anyone.
Reviews.Author: MP "MP"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I do not want to take my dSLR on my kayaking trips. I am slowy learning all the features & menus.  It is a struggle for me since there is no owner's manual and I am not very literate in camera computer language.Anyway, the wide angle lens is amazingly sharp. I am still figuring out how to adjust brightness and other functions.The camera size and weight are what I need.I am ordering another one for my sister. But boy, it costs $100 less than when I ordered mine 4 months ago. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Big camera in a small body
Reviews.Author: Kofty
Reviews.Content: Makes amazing photos from the very beginning - but have to use Auto mode a lot, as its numerous functions need a bit of an explanation (to be found in a 335 page pdf, but well worth the read).I love this camera because 1) it is so small it fits into my trouser pockets, 2) it gives me a range of options - from a real wide angle to a very good zoom and 3) it makes excellent photos.I will invest some more time to investigate more functions, maybe the WiFi connection (boy does that sound complicated) - but in combination with my Mac and iPhoto/Aperture, the Canon S110 is all the camera I need to have.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! WOW quality!
Reviews.Author: Daniel A.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to buy this camera, you already know it's one of the best in this format.But man the quality on this is fantastic!I had many point and shoot over the years, and i never knew they can be this tight and well constructed.Buy it you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: Gave us beautiful perfect pictures!
Reviews.Author: Philip Olivan
Reviews.Content: After hearing so much about S95, we wanted to look for the latest version of the S product line, and viola S100 and S110 were on our list. After taking some pictures, the camera exceeded our expectations by a mile! Those cameras are highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: I love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: N. Master "ndmaster"
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera as a replacement for my broken DSLR. The picture quality is great for a camera at this price point. Even better is the video and playback quality. It performs decent in low light, even though it is not a particularly low light capable lens. Another benefit is the WiFi capability, making it easy to upload photos to your computer or wherever you want to store them.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: Has many features that are available on my SLR digital. Good for travel. Only dislike I have is the lens ring sticks out quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: Goodbye Power Shot SD1100 IS
Reviews.Author: Susan Beach
Reviews.Content: HELLO Power Shot S110!  I have thoroughly enjoyed using my old SD1100 and was sad to see it go but enjoying the bigger viewing screen and image stabilizer.

Reviews.Title: nice feature set
Reviews.Author: Cory Kreikemeier
Reviews.Content: very well done, WIFI to phone/computer works very well for transferring photos, love these options and this was an upgrade for us from the S95 so we already knew the camera would do great but it has exceeded our expectations so far

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Broadhurst Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have a big DSLR camera that I use for landscape photography and this one for just about everything else.I wanted to have a small camera as a carry around camera, this one is perfect!  It's very compact.When I researched small cameras, this one came out on top. When I went to the store,I told the person I wanted a small camera that takes great photos to see what he would recommend.He said that there's only one choice, the Canon Powershot.This camera takes great low light photos and is perfect for when you are taking photos of people when at a party, reunion or when sightseeing.  It does not zoom as much as other cameras, but I have my big DSLR for those situations.  I also have used the PowerShot for taking videos and it does a nice job.  The other thing this Powershot is good for is taking photos of home interiors, so if you are a Realtor or doing home improvements, you can't beat this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Chris Wyant
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my girlfriend whom is an aspiring photographer. Unfortunately the first camera had dead pixels/black lines on the screen. Amazon was quick to ship out a new one that has since been flawless.  I normally don't write reviews I just wanted to point out that Amazon did a great job of taking care of me here. I considered buying one of these for my self for the days I don't wish to carry around my Canon 5D.

Reviews.Title: Good all around
Reviews.Author: Manitauk
Reviews.Content: Wanted something small and inexpensive enough to not hesitate to take it everywhere, and was willing to take a little hit in quality to get it. Didn't have to. Photos look amazing, video is great. Does everything for which we were considering getting the next step up.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera for the average user
Reviews.Author: ysugar
Reviews.Content: this camera is great for the average user or someone a little more serious on vacation. the full manual controls are a must have for anyone that is used to shooting manual on a dslr.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and build quality
Reviews.Author: shovenose
Reviews.Content: This camera has a good picture, solid build quality, a reasonable intuitive design and button layout, and battery life is better than expected. However, low light performance is not as good as I hoped for the price. Video is also pretty bad. Popup flash is cool though.Overall I'd highly recommend this if you need something compact. If you're serious about photography while this does not have the same flexibilty and large sensor as a DSLR however it does carry most of the software options for it in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: jack chiang
Reviews.Content: Very good quality pictures. Very handy and easy to use.the only dislike is the pop up flash light that get in the way of holding the camera.

Reviews.Title: Ecellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Stephane Cojot-goldberg
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant to use. Controls are easily accessible. Good quality paper prints. Light, bright screen and 24mm lens. Bravo Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: I loved my camera. It is so perfect that you can send pics to your phone. I used it during my trip in the US.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Fabio Machado
Reviews.Content: This camera proved to be everything that I wanted. Nice pics, manual or automatic settings, good night time resolution, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Great camera, takes really awsome pictures, great point and shot, the wifi is a great feature that all cameras should have!!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Marla Cross
Reviews.Content: This in an amazing camera. I haven't had a ton of time to learn it all yet, but I have yet to take a bad picture with it. I researched for months before finally making the choice to purchase this one, and I am 100% satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Canon s110
Reviews.Author: Mdrudge
Reviews.Content: Happy with the quality of pictures and size of the camera.  I have owned previous Canons so I am excited to see how much better this one is.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, small sized.
Reviews.Author: Jose E. Roshardt
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, small sized.  Good for traveling and business.  Elegant design, may be the only "con" would be that it doesn't have an optical visor.

Reviews.Title: quick delivery and worked as published.
Reviews.Author: MFMP "The Azua Man"
Reviews.Content: quick delivery and worked as published. no problems at all.  taking superb pictures.  saved over 100.00 compared to a new camera and this one was a new.

Reviews.Title: All the functions of big camera in a convenient size
Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  Love the large screen and it's a touch screen!  I shot photos all over Europe for a month.  The camera is very user-friendly and I love all the functionalities - I haven't even used them all yet.  I need to sit down and read the manual since there have been a lot of upgrades since my last PowerShot camera.  Good thing with Canon's is that they are very consistent so you can almost always figure out how touse it without the manual.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: FERNANDO LORDELO
Reviews.Content: Very fast camera, nice touch screen interface, many manual controls, F2.0 lens takes beautiful shots in low light conditions. Definitely a great buy!

Reviews.Title: One of the best cameras I've ever owned (and I've had quite a few)
Reviews.Author: Ezra
Reviews.Content: The thing I hate about the camera the most is that I think I'm a pretty good photographer but everyone always says "your pictures all look so great, you must have a great camera" I usually just scowl and say "I have six cameras".  You will never get credit as this camera always does. But yes for anything you can put in your pocket, this camera totally rocks.  It's the camera that more SLR junkies take with them when they leave their SLR at home.  You can control almost everything and if you are doing underwater stuff it's better than anything I've ever owned at any price.  If you get the dive housing and the aftermarket underwater filter and set the camera to underwater it is truly amazing. Here's some video I shot [...]The wifi is useless so don't bother with that, but I'm in it for the image.

Reviews.Title: Canon S110 is Super
Reviews.Author: William D. Jobe "broncobill44"
Reviews.Content: This little mid priced camera is easy to sue and is easy to carry on hikes, to parties, and other events. I am enjoying it for ease of use and photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Some feature new, some removed make it an optional update
Reviews.Author: Robert Cozzi
Reviews.Content: The previous S100 included a GPS, I owned that camera. The image quality is very good and its great to have GPS tagging your photo locations (unless you don't travel or don't care about that). Most people ask "Where was this taken" The bad news, the NEW S110 had its GPS removed (from the prior S100 model) and replaced with a questionable Wi-Fi feature. While all of Nikon's new point & shoots are adding Wi-Fi on top of GPS or GPS on top of Wi-Fi, CANON choose to remove GPS; replacing it with Wi-fi. There for, I have no value in this new model and will return it.Pro: Great images, easy to use, wonderful ergonomics, and nice LCD.Cons: No GPS, not great (just okay) battery life.If you don't care about GPS, this is a great camera, just make sure you turn off the Wi-Fi to increase your battery life.Why am I miffed at CANON for removing GPS and replacing it with Wi-Fi? I own DSLRs that include optional add-ons for wi-fi and/or GPS. I find the wi-fi option cute, but unnecessary today, but GPS to be extremely useful. I am assuming CANON did market research and decided a larger majority of SmartPhone uses want to transmit their photos to their phones. (Not sure why these folks aren't just using the camera in their phones instead of an S110, but whatever.) For me, loading the photos onto my laptop and not seeing where they were taken is sometimes disappointing. But that's just me, you may not care, so in that case, you'll not find a better camera, and if you're like me and really want GPS, get the S100 instead.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. David Groce
Reviews.Content: Liked the Canon s95; this camera is even better.  It fits in my pocket and takes great pictures including raw.

Reviews.Title: Shutter release problems. Avoid this camera
Reviews.Author: shelly butler
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the shutter release button, which started out sporadically, but now the shutter button won't work at all. Pressing the button will focus the image, but will not take the photo. Canon is refusing to repair my camera unless I pay $160 even though this seems to be a widespread problem. Canon's excuse is that the warranty has expired, but the problem wasn't so bad in the beginning, so I didn't feel the need to repair it ( I thought I wasn't focusing properly), but it got progressively worse over time.

Reviews.Title: terrible battery performance
Reviews.Author: papillon
Reviews.Content: I did not bought this from amazon but wanted to write the review here for larger audience.This camera will start showing battery pack is low with within 50 shots or few minutes of videoNot usable for a day trip or talking at least few hundred picture and video without a 2nd battery packThe wifi is simply a joke... the setup is horrible and very complex almost no real use unless going through all canon website and their links ... and turning on your wifi will drain the battery in hours..This is a rip off from s100 and no wonder the camera is on sale in many website under 220 (abes of main) just because this is a bad product

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot I've used
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly for filming travel & vlogs.  I haven't really taken any photos with it, but I can say for video, its got amazing stabilization, great audio and it's a perfect size.  One thing to note is that as far as I can tell there are no manual controls in video, the only thing I saw was the ability to turn on and off a built in ND filter which was nice for daytime stuff.  It looks like you can also setup a flat picture profile.  It's no wonder Casey Neistat says its the best camera ever made :)

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: L. Pagan
Reviews.Content: I've never had a really good quality camera before - mostly just used to the ones on my phones. But this just blew me away. I'm certainly no photography expert, and I'm sure a really expensive DSLR could wipe the floor with this, but for ease of use for the quality of the pictures - amazing! I've just been shooting in auto mode and everything comes out crystal clear with true-to-life color.And since I snatched it for about half the price since the newer model came out, I have to say it's completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome with CMOS 'chip'
Reviews.Author: MacBobT "catso"
Reviews.Content: I forgot what it's called, not exactly a 'chip, but it really improves digital photos along with Canon's software. So far I've only used auto, haven't gotten to A or S preferred. The video mode works well also. Buy it when it's on sale for two-nineteen.

Reviews.Title: Quality Good, but Video has AF annoying SOUND!!
Reviews.Author: Andrea L. Lunsford
Reviews.Content: This camera has depth of field which makes the background images blurry while focuses on the target item up close. It has face recognition which you can set up and all that jazz. Great. Well, the video part sucks and here's why: the video is excellent ok? But the auto focus knocks REALLY LOUD while you're taking a video. It's annoying and distracting and it is almost a deal breaker because I make a daily vlog that relies on a good camera with good sound. The annoying clicks, clanks, and knocking is so distracting that its all you focus on. There is an auto focus lock, but you greatly lose quality when you do this. Why didn't anyone think about this? Why does no one mention it?!

Reviews.Title: Record Button Has Moved
Reviews.Author: Amazoon "2MuchStuff"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the S110 for for my wife, who was used to using the Canon S95 (which she accidentally dropped). While she's generally pleased with the performance of the camera, she did complain about the position of the (dedicated) video record button. On the S95, she was used to simply pressing the shutter button to activate the RECORD function, but now there's a dedicated button which is located to the right of the LCD screen. Because of this, she can no longer hold up her camera at concerts, etc. and hit RECORD with one finger. She needs both hands. I mentioned to her that there may be a menu setting which will allow the shutter to activate video recording like the S95 did, but I haven't explored this yet. There's also the classic "shutter lag" that this camera series suffers from, but that's not a deal breaker (at least for me). All said, it's a solid camera that takes rich, colorful photos. I'd give it 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Little Camera that Could
Reviews.Author: Michael Ray
Reviews.Content: Big brother to the S95 I have been using.....the touch focus feature in on screen composing ....was a leap forward.....now if it only had a phone feature !

Reviews.Title: Mixed bag
Reviews.Author: Harriet
Reviews.Content: Easy to carry in pocket or purse but controls too small to use easily. On/Off control tiny. Since my previous digital camera was a Canon, how to use the camera's basic functions were intuitive to use. Still need to study the manual to learn the more advanced options. Not impressed with picture quality in zoom mode. Like the touch screen option to take photos although when I go to use the two finger expansion of the image, I am as often as not libel to take an unexpected picture as well!

Reviews.Title: Sweeeet
Reviews.Author: Christopher Buzon
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this camera you already know it's amazing.  Buy a 32 gig card with it, take some video, shoot a lot.  Regret nothing.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Offsky
Reviews.Content: The wrist strap was extremely difficult for me to thread through the tiny holes.  Maybe I was just unlucky. Otherwise good camera.

Reviews.Title: Comprado desde España - Excelente elección
Reviews.Author: CedricPuchalski
Reviews.Content: He comprado este cámara desde España y ha sido una muy buena elección.El precio con respecto al mismo producto en España es muy inferior.

Reviews.Title: Amazing pictures in/out doors but apparent white noise in video
Reviews.Author: Choonik Lee
Reviews.Content: Amazing indoor outdoor pictures. But there is obvious white noise recorded during video taking. For a recording of very quiet scene, you will definitely notice it. However, considering its amazing picture quality, I will say this is a keeper!Wifi connection with my iPhone 5 was smooth through my wifi router at home. The camera itself works as wifi hotspot, which lets you connect your smart device directly to S110. I'm giving 4.5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Great for golf recording
Reviews.Author: Todd D Heugly
Reviews.Content: I am a golf instructor and have been very pleased with this camera.  The slow motion sports recordingis great for recording golf swings.  You can record at 120 fps with good picture quality and at 240 fps with a little less clear picture quality, but nothing to sway you from buying this camera.  Good job Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: ryan hoffman
Reviews.Content: Excellant picture taking and easy to take pictures.The WiFi is a little complicated, but doesn't take away from the overall usefullness of the camera

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: W.H. "WPH"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Take high quality photo for a pocket camera.  Amazing HD video.  Very nice optics. Battery life is excellent as well.  It was hard to decide whether to get this white one or the black one.

Reviews.Title: Great product, as-expected shipping
Reviews.Author: Scott Galla
Reviews.Content: Great camera, compact.  You get what you pay for and if you're looking for a compact point and shoot, this is the one to buy.  Only downside would be that the interface for uploading photos is sometimes clunky.

Reviews.Title: Previous PowerShot owner who upgraded and is SUPER HAPPY
Reviews.Author: K. Shelby
Reviews.Content: I owned my other PowerShot since 2007 and decided to buy a new one this year since my low-light pics were less than desirable with my old camera.  OMG!!  This camera is fantastic on the auto setting and I love the camera.  I also read some low reviews about getting the wi-fi established but I had no issues getting mine working since I called Canon customer service and had them walk me through the process.  Bottom line, I love this camera and it is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Nirvana
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The picture quality is great and it's very easy to use.  The new wifi feature makes this as camera as useful as the camera app on the iphone.  The only complaint I have is the setup process is not as friendly.

Reviews.Title: I have posted videos on Youtube with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Dennis K. McCann
Reviews.Content: People in my dance group ask my to come and tale pictures and videos.  I selected this camera because it has good low light lever response.

Reviews.Title: Exellent, compact camera
Reviews.Author: G. Courtade
Reviews.Content: I have owned several cameras in this "S" series and this is the best so far. Everything works well and it is nicely made. The image quality is superb especially for the size of the camera. It's very compact and convenient as well as very capable. MT highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: Compact, but with just enough controls
Reviews.Author: JH
Reviews.Content: The S110 is a pretty little camera that fits easily in a pocket or jacket, and at the same time takes nicer pictures than a smartphone. What's really neat about it is that it's got just enough manual controls to satisfy someone used to a larger, camera with more manual controls. The control ring around the lens is especially neat.

Reviews.Title: Gave it as a gift
Reviews.Author: Dustin Cote
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good camera, but I gave it as a gift so I don't have too much insight.  It looked pretty solid out of the box and my parents (not terribly technically inclined) were able to figure out the basics of taking pictures and connecting it to wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack G. Scott
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my son.  So far, he likes it a lot, but hasn't really had much of a chance to use it yet.  The camera arrived when it was promised and so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Wifi function is GREAT!
Reviews.Author: M. Hsu "Lizard"
Reviews.Content: I was debating on S100 and LX7 last Thanksgiving.  S110 has signifcant higher price at that time. S100 was slow and has lag. I ended up with LX7. However, I found LX7 was a bit large size for me especially with case on it. For the whole year, I ended up taking my DSLR D90 most of the time since LX7 wasn't really that convenient after all(e.g. lens cap, setting, Will go into more detail). I sold it last month.Then, I notice the price drop on S110. It is much smaller camera. Excellent pictures! exactly what I need.  The major function that I like the most is the WIFI. I can set my Nexus 5 to connect to S110 and upload my photos into my Facebook, Flicker, or let it dropbox!!!  I can share it, back up, and not afraid of sd card problem or camera lost!  I think this Camera is much better deal and take much better pictures and has function similar to Samsung Galaxy Zoom.

Reviews.Title: small sweet different
Reviews.Author: soumya sitaraman
Reviews.Content: I like the HD video this little camera has to offer and the standardized battery that is the same as my earlier powershot.Was a little disappointed with that cannon reconfigured buttons and changed working features. Client comfort comes from familiarity and ease of use.5x zoom was a BIG down…there are other options with 20x and a better megapixel rating but batteries, chargers etc are different!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worth buying
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Loving it. Best buy ever. From the first moment I started using it, I fell in love with it! Easy to use controls plus great pics

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S110
Reviews.Author: Michele Wahnsiedler
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  It's easy to use, and it takes great videos too.  It's simple enough for me to understand.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love it, instead returning it
Reviews.Author: lindros
Reviews.Content: As the owner of an S95 (purchased December 2010 from Amazon), I wanted to love this camera.  We had to replace the S95 after it met its fate (or rather, dust and some liquid permeated the image sensor).After 5 days with the S110, it's going back.  The price is incredible - 41% less than the S95 in a mere three years.The feature set - on paper - is also class-leading (including a touchscreen).  The camera is also faster to start up and menu responsiveness is outstanding.  The rough surface is great to hold - very impressive and smart by Canon.Unfortunately, the image quality has been terrible (blurry on 80% of the shots).  The flash coverage is rubbish (compared with my S95).  Not sure why it's all so bad... but I'm holding out for the next generation.

Reviews.Title: Very good,I very like it
Reviews.Author: zhoubin
Reviews.Content: Black Very good,I very like it.Hope can buy such a good product！It supports multiple languages, very good！If cheaper then even better。

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use camera.
Reviews.Author: Zuhair Y. Al Zuhair
Reviews.Content: But as many other electronic devices, there is no catalog with the camera explaining in details all the different options it can perform. have to search more to find out how it really operates

Reviews.Title: Superb functionality
Reviews.Author: heri
Reviews.Content: Just love the camera and fully enjoying its instant clicking n opening closing . Light weight is big advantage and the colors in image reflects as amazing and picture quality is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Meets all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Gary Scott
Reviews.Content: Meets all my expectations easy to use and has all the features I require from a small point and shoot camera

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S110 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)
Reviews.Author: BONNIE J MATTHEWS
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon user and I love this PowerShot. It is everything you could want in a compact/pocket size camera. I have used it in various lighting situations and Canon lives up to its name once again. I received the camera as promised even during the Christmas holiday's, the package was perfect and I am very happy. You can't go wrong with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jim B"
Reviews.Content: This camera is truly amazing. Lots of great features. The only drawback is that it's just a 5x zoom. If you don't need more zoom than that, this camera is great for most applications.

Reviews.Title: Furious
Reviews.Author: Nathan's Mama
Reviews.Content: We returned this camera in January since the lens cover stopped opening.  Just now had a chance to review the video we took with it on Christmas Day.  The videos are horrible and pixelated. Not a clear picture at all.  I have a canon 40D and am a canon person but I am incredibly frustrated at how my twins' first Christmas videos are essentially ruined.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working within 4 months
Reviews.Author: brittany frederick
Reviews.Content: I barely used this camera.. I just used it every once in a while for a few videos and photos every now and then. Within month four of owning it, it just stopped working. It won't turn on. I tried recharging the battery, I even bought a new battery thinking maybe that was the problem- but it was in fact the camera itself. I'm very upset.

Reviews.Title: Could Have Been Great
Reviews.Author: kwikgoal
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for an older Canon.  The reviews for the camera were fairly positive, with the stickler being the possibility of getting the lemon lens.  One of the deciding factors for me when compared to others in this price range was that the batter/charger were the same as my old camera.  Well, I have been using the camera for several weeks now, and believe I have seen the good and the bad of this camera.Pros:Solid body.  Built to last.Generally great pictures.Auto focus works very well.Auto flash is very good.
