Only comes on when needed.Good view screen with decent touch interface.Videos are good to.Cons:The flash is in the wrong spot.The picture snap response is slow (auto focus?).The processing speed is slow (buffer?).  Forget rapid shooting; you really have to wait a long time between pics.Unfortunately, I didn't hold this camera before I bought it.  When the flash comes on, inevitably my finger is in the way.  I don't see how you can hold this camera well without running into this.  Maybe it is designed to be used with only one hand, but I won't probably ever do that.  I have had others play with it too, and they say the same thing (without any prompting).The problem I had with my old camera was that it was too slow when I lined up a shot and pressed the button.  Sometimes it seemed like 2 or 3 seconds before it would snap the picture.  It also took a long time before you could snap another shot.  I thought some newer hardware would fix that, but I was wrong.  Different body, different software, same issues.I will keep the camera, but will definitely try the camera before buying next time.  Though the camera is generally very good, the cons really weigh on this one.  I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but not yet a Canon
Reviews.Author: Point and shoot camera buying guide
Reviews.Content: Overall, I quite satisfy with this camera. There is only one thing that I expect more from a camera with this sensor size is the ISO performance. Despite the fact that Canon makes this camera aiming for low light shooters, this camera is not quite there yet. For a general shooting purpose, it's perfect otherwise.More reviews at http://bestpointandshootcamera4u.com

Reviews.Title: Great Camara
Reviews.Author: M. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: By far,  the best pocket camera in the market!!! I highly recommend it!! You can take great pictures and not spending a lot of money!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Belleza
Reviews.Content: Great camera, love the features especially that it's WiFi capable. Love the feel of the body. Only negative is that it doesn't have a viewfinder, but that didn't matter to me.

Reviews.Title: bad quality
Reviews.Author: Tatyana
Reviews.Content: just after few months of use, camera started to overheat. And after that time you can't even exchange it or return.

Reviews.Title: canon s110
Reviews.Author: Marty J. Burke "burkex1"
Reviews.Content: Can someone help me with the setting for this camera.. just want to take good pictures of kids in sports and family stuff. thers 16:9.. 3:2 4:3 etc.. which should i be on..the one issue I dislike is the on/off utton hard to turn on

Reviews.Title: Best Christmas present ever!!
Reviews.Author: Jackie Martino
Reviews.Content: My dauughter  has wanted a good camera for a long time . So she was so excited when she opened this camera!She has a cousin who has the 100 model and her dad says its as good as the rebel without the bulk

Reviews.Title: Z Best Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: T. J. Williams "Closet Billonaire"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is amazing.  Delivers great shoots in low light and outside on bright sunny day.  Perfect size--easy to carry, take along-- even when shooting with Nikon D600 DSLR.  Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Wasn't that great the first night, much better now.
Reviews.Author: Farshad
Reviews.Content: The first night I opened it, I was not at all impressed, I wish I had just kept my SD4000 IS PowerShot and asked for something else for Christmas.  I took pictures side by side and it wasn't that impressed.  Not sure what the problem was then (condensation?  The box sat outside for hours before I brought it in and opened it) but it has gotten better.1) There are lots of improvements over my older Canons but this is definitely bulkier and bigger2) The wireless feature works great with my home wifi and my Android.  Took no time at all to setup either.3) Low light pictures do seem a lot more bright, as if there is a hidden flash, but are grainy.4) Camera is solid, feels great in your hand5) The "ring" isn't a smooth turning one, it "clicks" quite awkwardly between each setting, so you go clicking through options and not in a way you can run through them, one at a time, and not smooth at all, I find myself using the menu items instead.6) The touchscreen is awesome!7) Touchscreen picture taking is useless, you'd be taking pictures all the time, there is no way to hold the camera really without touching the screenIn the end, I was quite happy to get a new and fairly cheap camera, but it simply isn't THAT much better than my SD4000, except in low light, and then not super low light, just low light.I have since ordered and received the Sony RX100.  Which is why I waited to return this camera, wanted to compare them side by side.  After a couple of days of "playing" (yes I'm clearly not a professional, but I'd guess nor are most consumers), here are my thoughts:1) The picture quality of the RX100 is better, but not always, and not that much more, sure it has a lot more pixels, but over all, not a huge difference.  For just pictures, for ordinary consumer, I'd say get the S110, for being almost half the price, the pictures aren't THAT much different.2) The RX100's menus are awesome for those who aren't well versed in photography, it actually explains what each setting does and is for, even with a sample picture, and then within each has sub menus explaining what they do, with yet more pictures, and finally has a help button.  FANTASTIC!3) S110's wifi is great, RX100 has none.  Sending pictures to your phone and then posting or emailing them on the fly is really great.4) As great as the S110's low light "brightness" is, the RX100 is a good 10 times better on really low lights.  When there is enough light for you to see fairly clearly, they seem close, but when it's dark enough where you can't make out too clearly what you are looking at, and you can no longer see the colors, the RX100 can still take pictures that look like a cheap camera WITH a flash took (with a flash of course they both look great), where as the S110 takes pictures similar to what your eyes see when it's that dark.  The RX100 really shines with no flash in pretty darn dark settings.5) There are lots of other things the RX100 does, but might not be of interest to you, but they are there, like take pictures while recording video (but only in interlaced video, when I put it on p it doesn't let me take pictures), but those pictures aren't as great as doing so without video recording in room conditions.  The function ring is much better as well.6) S110's touchscreen awesomeness is missing7) You can still put an S110 in your back pocket, though it would be like a thick heavy wallet.  The RX100 however is almost a centimeter thicker and most of that is the lens sticking out further so I wouldn't call it a pocket camera.  The S110 feels better (grainy, square metal feel, but the Sony has a smooth more rounded metal finish) and looks better.

Reviews.Title: Apple compatibility
Reviews.Author: sbenisch
Reviews.Content: Apple's Aperture recognizes the RAW format used by this camera.  This camera's WiFi is designed to connect easily with Apple's Macs.These features (among others) appeal to me, as I shop for a new camera.I'd appreciate comments from Apple users.

Reviews.Title: Still learning everything it can do.
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie Hayes
Reviews.Content: Enjoying the pictures I think you should say what you need to have the camera work in the display, it would make it easier I had to order twice.

Reviews.Title: We love Canon Camera's
Reviews.Author: James Hayden "Tell us about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: This Canon Camera is awesome.  The pictures are tremendous and the features are wonderful.  Wi-Fi is great.  Buy it now!  You will not regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: iffy camera
Reviews.Author: N. Chaudhari
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a while now and it seemed decent at first but I think I can say now that I'm not a big fan of this one. I have almost canon exclusively and have loved many of my previous ones like the s1000 and the a80 along with my dslr. In a pinch I  like to rely of the auto setting and just shoot and go. Maybe I still need to figure out the settings but the focus target is so erratic a lot of shots just come out focused on something seemingly random. In that hurried moment, the picture is lost, something you may not even realize until you have time later to look them over. I just took it again on a trip hiking and while some did come out very well, about 1/4 of the shots got thrown away from bad focus or too blurry (even trying to balance on a rock). Some pictures will come out in raw+jpg while others just jpg. More settings and issues I need to reread on. So overall as canon pocket cameras go I wish I could return this and try another one.

Reviews.Title: Can't connect to Wi-Fi if you're on a Mac
Reviews.Author: heel5man
Reviews.Content: I have owned the S90, S95 and S100 and they're great cameras. I bought the S110 mostly to get the wi-fi and GPS. The problem is that to activate the wi-fi, you need to be able to connect the S110 to your computer and it couldn't be done with a recent version of Mac OS. Canon tech support said the driver was due in mid-October, but that it was delayed. I returned the camera. Hopefully it will be available soon, but I wasn't willing to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: Many Thanks
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Al seraihi
Reviews.Content: I received my order in same date and at good candation  5 star is good .Many Thanks for you

Reviews.Title: Billy
Reviews.Author: William Bowman
Reviews.Content: Expensive. Meets expectations and is intuitive and easy to use. About ae food as a point and shoot compact camera gets.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S110
Reviews.Author: Ashley Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera bases on reviews from another website. When I received it from amazon you could tell the box was already opened and the camera had been used. Finger prints all over the screen. But that was not why I gave it one star. It was because all the pictures I took with it came out blurry and with a yellow tint to them. Sending this camera back to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Canon S110 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Motorcycle Traveler
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived with everything in the box that should be there.  The number of shots per battery charge is poor enough that I went to the effort to purchase a spare battery (not from Amazon).  Another small issue with the camera is the pop-up flash.  It's right where you tend to hold the camera with your left hand which blocks the flash.  If I had it to do again, i might pick another camera (different flash location, and a longer zoom.)  Picture quality is decent.  12mp seems to meet my needs.  Operationally, it seems pretty straight forward to operate.  Only real disappointment is that 2-3 weeks after purchase the price dropped by over 12%.  Had I known that was coming, I would have waited to purchase.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: David McAllister
Reviews.Content: ...but it is impossible to insert the hand strap into the place allotted for it. I guess you just have to be careful not to drop the camera while using it. They should ship them with the strap already attached.

Reviews.Title: can't connect iPhone 5 to camera
Reviews.Author: tc
Reviews.Content: I've been trying for 2 days to connect the camera using the camera as an access point to an iphone 5.  The iphone just won't connect.  There is a little addendum in the box that explains that when trying to connect an iphone, it will "appear" to not be connected and the network connecting icon on the iphone will keep spinning, but it really is connected.  Well...that isn't the case for me.  It just won't connect.I've been on with canon tech support for 30 minutes now (on hold now)...and they only have androids to test it on.  So he is checking for other solutions.But as of now, the direct connect from the camera to the iphone is not working.

Reviews.Title: case
Reviews.Author: Zzqamanda
Reviews.Content: It was supposed to contain a case but it didn't. Besides that, I found the product favorable.I like it

Reviews.Title: Is Canon going down the tubes?
Reviews.Author: hhnewman
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon lover for the last twenty years and bought an s110 about six weeks ago, choosing it over the earlier models because of the wifi system to connect to my Macs. To my complete dismay, it is a mess; I've spent hours attempting by myself to download image to no avail. I've tried their software which, after installed, appears to not be removable unless you trash the entire Canon Utilities folder (I had hoped that their wifi app in itself would do the job without the annoying other apps).  Furthermore, after you install CameraWindow, you can't disable it.I then called Canon, and wasted an hour with a fellow who know nothing and who kept putting me on hold to talk to other people.  In the end the best they could offer was to install their proprietary software, which came out to be a nightmare.So, Canon, a company known and respected for quality, knowingly puts out a defective product and collects money from its devoted customers, then forces them to use defective software.In my world this is called 'Squeezing the Monkey,' the last gasps of a corporation on the way out.

Reviews.Title: I bought the camera for the wifi capability
Reviews.Author: steve allen
Reviews.Content: after an hour with the Canon tec dept who could figuer out how to link the camera to our wifi they blamed it on ATT.  Then an hour with a very knowledgeable ATT tec person who finally said the problem is clearly not our U Verse wifi.  I had been able to simpliy link both my home computer to the UVerse wifi with no problem but not this camera.  I called back to Canon tec group.  This time I got a very smart guy who tried it once and seeing it didn't work said this Canon  Power Shot S110 will not connect to wifi.  He went on to say it is the best camera of its type the Canon has made, but the wifi part doesn't work.  He went on to say the only camera that will link to wifi is the N. The N isn't the camera I wanted.  Since the only reason I bought the camera was because of the wifi capability it turned out to be worthless to me.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Herbert Glaser
Reviews.Content: I will never buy another Canon camera product. Purchased a Canon S100 15 months ago. The camera drained the two new batteries I bought plus the  included one. I returned the camera to the retail dealer who sent it to Canon for repair. The warranty expired after 1 year and Canon wants $195.00 to repair a camera that cost about $300.00. What a piece of junk....I barely used the camera during the 15 months of ownership.

Reviews.Title: Does not work in cold weather
Reviews.Author: Paupard
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work outside when it is cold. It is a useless camera unless you live in a warm climate.

Reviews.Title: No Video
Reviews.Author: W. J. Smith "Wendy"
Reviews.Content: For some reason the video on this camera has NEVER worked.  When I press the button and have it on the video setting, it just takes a still shot.  I just contacted Canon to see what they can do...

Reviews.Title: Don't buy for WIFI, Terrible Usability
Reviews.Author: A. Alami "climber"
Reviews.Content: False advertising on the WIFI.  Purchased this model mainly because of the WIFI and have been very disappointed with how hard it is to setup.  First off the package comes with a CD for install, out of our 3 computers in the house none have a CD player.  Canon's website is not user friendly and after 30 minutes of downloading various files we still can't get the wifi to work, won't connect to our home network, printer, laptop.  The download just included thier image browser program which is lacking when compared to Picasa.  I just want a simple camera that's intuitive, easy to use, and works. They should have one package bundle to download and take lessons from Apple.  The help files on the canon site are lacking in information or detail.  BTW- I'm a very technical person who runs an internet startup.

Reviews.Title: No Viewfinder in This Nice Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Spoilin' Grandma
Reviews.Content: The Technical Details (under "See More Technical Details", the expanded list) state that this camera has an electronic viewfinder.  IT DOES NOT!  I ordered this camera on December 4, 2013 and received it on December 10.  Before I ordered it, I contacted customer service to confirm that it did indeed have a viewfinder, as I had found conflicting information on various sites.  The rep stated with absolute certainty that it actually had a viewfinder.  It does not.  During three different communications with Amazon people, I was assured that the description would be changed so that others would not experience the same inconvenience that I did.  Now, 42 days after my purchase, they still have not changed the description.This looked like a great little camera--good reviews, convenient size, etc.  Unfortunately, because of the nearing holidays and the loss of time regarding this mixup, I was pressured into buying another Amazon camera (which was quite overpriced) and given more inaccurate information and assurances from Amazon rep's.  The bottom line is that I spent approximately $475 for another camera to get the viewfinder and still have not received the credit I was promised.  I was told to order it with expedited shipping, and I would be reimbursed for the special shipping.  Now they refuse to refund it.  I waited for more than a month to write this review, hoping I would be treated fairly, but Amazon has refused to honor their rep's commitments.  This is the greatly condensed version of this fiasco.  It has been a total disaster.'

Reviews.Title: clips.blur.on.and.off
Reviews.Author: branda
Reviews.Content: The camera is not what I expected to be for the money I paid.The flashing doesnt always work and it takes too long to snap a picture from one to the next..The worst part is that.the.camera.blurs.while.taking.a.clip..I.already.received.a.replacement.from.Amazon.but.the.replacement.is.just.the.same.faulty....

Reviews.Title: Review_Canon powershot s110
Reviews.Author: JUNG,SUNKYUNG
Reviews.Content: Actually, i don't know how to use this and carmera.but it is useful and easy for me.it is very good

Reviews.Title: Won't work with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Michael March
Reviews.Content: I got the camera, loaded the software, took some shots. I went to download, it downloaded 80 then froze. I called Canon they said, "Change your operating system to Windows 8 from windows 7. The sales pitch says, of course, that it works with Windows 7.  I'm done with Canon

Reviews.Title: No way
Reviews.Author: AH, Florida.
Reviews.Content: Small and all that but pictures lack clarity, zoom is a mess as well.not comparable to a dslr, better than an iPhone camera but not by much

Reviews.Title: light problem
Reviews.Author: Bluesea
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to hold with two hands because of the light position. And the light is too strong in the short distance. The picture is too white when using the light. The white balance is the big problem when using the light.

Reviews.Title: A step backwards
Reviews.Author: Simple honest man
Reviews.Content: I wish I hadn't purchased this model.  The previous one had the features I wanted .  this model has GPS, but only if connected to your iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Rullophotography.com says buy something else
Reviews.Author: Rayboy
Reviews.Content: The focus is sooooo sloooow it will blow your mind, especially if you are used to the speed of a DSL and yes I know they are two different animals BUT wow!!!
